data.scheme_name: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Udhyog Uday Yojana for SC/ST Entrepreneurs for MSME - Assistance for Quality Certification - SC/ST - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides assistance upto 75% of the capital cost for ERP installation (up to Rs. 1 lakh), 60% of certification fees for national/international certification, and 60% of testing equipment and machinery costs (up to Rs. 10 lakh).
data.eligibility:
1.  Micro, Small & Medium Manufacturing Enterprise.
  2.  The Enterprise which has obtained BSI/ISI/WHO-GMP/Hallmark certifications & other National/International certification from suggested/ referred/ approved/ recognized/ empaneled certification body (Excluding ISO Certification).
data.conditions:
1.  ERP system should be with server and software facilitating details of production, inventory control, sales, purchase, accounting and Human Resource Management, etc.
  2.  The Capital Cost in ERP system includes installation charges, software and annual service cost
  3.  The Capital Cost does not include the hardware part of the ERP system
  4.  In case of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) based deployment option of ERP system, the annual subscription charges will be considered.
  5.  The cost for certificate will include :-
    • Fees charged by certification agency (excluding travel, hotel and surveillance charges)
    • Cost of testing equipment/machinery as required for certifications
    • Calibration charges of equipment
  6.  The enterprise will not be eligible if any certification is required as a part of statutory provision.
  7.  The testing equipment purchased after the issuance of Quality Certificate shall not be eligible for assistance
  8.  The enterprise shall have to apply within a year from the date of issue of the certificate
  9.  Expenditure incurred for renewal of certificate shall not be eligible for assistance under the scheme.
data.beneficiaries:
1.  Micro, Small & Medium Manufacturing Enterprise.
  2.  The Enterprise which has obtained BSI/ISI/WHO-GMP/Hallmark certifications & other National/International certification from suggested/ referred/ approved/ recognized/ empaneled certification body (Excluding ISO Certification).
data.prerequisites:
1.  ERP system should be with server and software facilitating details of production, inventory control, sales, purchase, accounting and Human Resource Management, etc.
  2.  The Capital Cost in ERP system includes installation charges, software and annual service cost.
  3.  The Capital Cost does not include the hardware part of the ERP system.
  4.  In case of Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) based deployment option of ERP system, the annual subscription charges will be considered.
  5.  The cost for certificate will include :-
    • Fees charged by certification agency (excluding travel, hotel and surveillance charges).
    • Cost of testing equipment/machinery as required for certifications.
    • Calibration charges of equipment.
  6.  The enterprise will not be eligible if any certification is required as a part of statutory provision.
  7.  The testing equipment purchased after the issuance of Quality Certificate shall not be eligible for assistance.
  8.  The enterprise shall have to apply within a year from the date of issue of the certificate.
  9.  Expenditure incurred for renewal of certificate shall not be eligible for assistance under the scheme.
data.context: The primary mission of The Industrial Policy 2020 includes support for development of MSMEs., focus on Export Competitiveness: Vocal for Local to become Global and thus integrated value chains across product segments.
data.objective: To extend support to MSME to get quality certification to introduce quality product in competitive market.
data.description:
1. Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System :- 75% of capital cost for installing ERP system of approved ERP services provided by Industries Commissionerate subject to a maximum amount of Rs. 100000.

2. Quality Certification :- 60% of fee payable to certification for National/International Certification (i.e. BIS/ISI/WHO/GMP/ Hallmark etc., and other national/international certifications) and 60% cost of testing equipment and machinery required for that certification totaling up to maximum amount of Rs. 10 lakhs. Assistance will include following charges.
data.how_to_apply:
1.  Enterprise has to apply online on IFP Portal (https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in)and hard copy at concern DIC office within one year from the date of issue of quality certificate.
  2.  Applicant can directly apply to concerned District Industries Centre (DIC) with following required documents :-
    • Copy of Entrepreneur Memorandum part- 2 of the Enterprise / Udyog Aadhaar No.
    • Copy of the Constitution of the Enterprise
    • CA Certificate for fixed capital investment
    • Copy of quality certification
    • CA certified Detailed expenditure statement for obtaining the quality certification
    • Undertaking for any assistances from GoG and GoI
    • Copy of the bill of software manufacturer which has provided for ERP system and features of the ERP system installed.
    • Copy of Gujarat Pollution Control Board approved NOC/Consent & other departments approval (if applicable)
    • Copy of PAN Card
    • Bank details for RTGS payment such as Bank Name, Account No. IFS Code No. & Branch code. etc.
    • Self-Attested documents / details to be submitted by the Authorized Person
data.funding_facilitator: Industries and Mines Department, Government of Gujarat
data.funding_mechanism: The assistance will be released after the approval by Industries Commissioner.
data.additional_info: The enterprise that has availed assistance under this component cannot avail assistance under any other scheme of other department of state government for the same component providing similar benefit. However, Enterprise can avail under such schemes of Government of India, if any.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Signed copy of Application form* 
2. Copy of Udyam Registration (if applicable) 
3. Copy of the Constitution of the enterprise 
4. Copy of PAN Card of Enterprise 
5. Copy of PAN Card of Applicant/Promoters/Directors/partners and authorised signatory 
6. CA certificate for fixed capital investment 
7. Copy of Quality Certification 
8. Copy of proof of Recognized/ Approved Certification body 
9. Proof of online verification of certification 
10. Undertaking for any assistance from GoG and GoI 
11. Copy of the Highlighted bank statement 
12. Copy of Gujarat Pollution Control Board approved NOC/Consent & other departments approval (if applicable) 
13. Copy of the cancelled cheque 
14. Copy of GST return of previous financial year (if applicable) 
15. Expenditure statement (CA Certified) 
16. Copy of ITR of the last financial year (if applicable) 
17. Copy of latest electricity bill 
18. Copy of Testing equipment Purchased booklet/ reference letter for quality testing instrument/equipment and machinery from authorized body 
19. Self-Attested documents/ details to be submitted by the Authorized Person 
20. Power of attorney/Board resolution/ Consent letter 
21. Caste Certificate
